summary: This document is a series of internal email communications from July 26, 2019, between staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York regarding the psychological observation status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It shows staff coordination and concern over his mental health classification just weeks before his death.

keyFacts: The document is dated July 26, 2019, approximately two weeks before Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
Epstein's psychological observation status was a point of discussion and concern among MCC staff, with the 'Central Office Psych' questioning a step-down from suicide watch (SW) to psych obs.
A Chief Psychologist at MCC justified the decision to lower Epstein's observation level and planned to interview him to confirm the assessment.
The Associate Warden needed to be notified of Epstein's assessment result to inform the Regional Director (RD), indicating high-level oversight.
The document reveals internal Bureau of Prisons procedures and communication regarding a high-profile inmate's mental health monitoring.
